title: RIOT Remove chat restriction punishments or make them fair and working properly.
body:
[I can't prove anything here but I have no reason too.) 

I  got chat restricted 4 months ago, I got it again today. My first one was for asking to report someone who was walking down mid and feeding. Now, I get chat restricted for telling a Chinese troll, to go back to his own region. I'm not saying I shouldnt be chat restricted but im saying these punishments are terrible. 
Before my first ban I was honor 4 and probably about to be honor 5 then i got banned for asking people to report (i report everyone who ask for reports ever since my banned and those people arent being banned, riot told me, that people who ask for reports are always punished)

I got honor 1, 3 months ago and I was 2/3 checkpoints to honor 2, now im reset back to honor 0. You shouldn't lose your honor unless you are saying shit every match and being toxic as hell. For the last 4 months, I have probably been nice 95% of the time, That is out of a shit ton of matches. It's just crazy that I have to go through another 4 months before im even close to honor 2, I might as well just being a toxic player because I see toxic people almost every game have honor 3/4/5s and they dont seem to be punished. Either fix the punishments or dont give them out at all. 


Basically what I am saying is that this system is trash and I see tons of toxic people being toxic, I report them and get no messages of their ban, I can't be 100% nice person all the time in such a toxic community like this. I get a chat restriction after having one 4 months ago for asking for a report and its stupid. 

If Riot post what I said in chat, make sure you (riot) post what the troll was saying so it has context.

This Board is for serious reports of in game bugs, not for discussing the chat restriction and honor systems. I am going to lock this thread up so it doesn't get bumped and take up important bug reporting space.

If you guys have any questions about this lock, feel free to come by the [Discord](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/community-moderation/qVlculPP-boards-moderation-discord).

Thanks

Few things here that seem to have escaped your notice.

1. It doesn't matter what someone else does since 2 wrongs don't make a right and you admitted you deserved the ban.


2. Riot's punishments are fair and the loss of honor etc is a known punishment for being toxic. IT's their as a deterrent so you won't be toxic. They tried just chat restrictions that didn't work so they escalated it.


3. It doesn't matter how many reports per game are sent in, it still only counts as 1 reported game. The system isn't going to nail you for 1 game unless your chat is filled with horrible stuff or you're feeding.


4. The fact you've been punished before means you're on Riots radar then and you had better behave.


5. Asking for someone else's chat logs is never going to happen and is a bad excuse to not post your own since you know you won't get them. That would violate their account privacy.


6. You're asking us to trust you and say believe you all the while trying to deflect blame onto someone else who may or may not have done what you said. You're also sitting here insulting those responding to you. For someone who's so innocent you sure do want to blame everyone else for what happened. 



Since S1 we've seen countless trolls, racists, flamers etc come to these forums all doing the exact same thing as you are doing. They've all been guilty as sin. The old Tribunal Ban Inquiries forum is littered with posts just like yours. No one here is going to believe you or trust you after what you've posted and we're in no way haters. We've just learned to know better. when we see these types of posts.


Lastly, we also aren't worried about getting banned falsely since while most of us have our moments we know to keep ourselves in check. We don't want to  become a negative statistic. If you really need to rebind your chat key to something hard to reach so once game starts you can only use the smart ping system.
